intro: Rechsteineria elatior, commonly known as the greater rechsteineria, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many species of grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in coastal or sandy environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
